definition: to put on a hat/to be first/to dub
lit. dressed up animal (idiom)/fig. immoral and despicable person

sentences.english: They have not found his body so they just make a cenotaph for him.
sentences.chinese: 他死后没有找到尸体，只能做了一个衣冠冢。

sentences.english: Animals who are dressed-up. An analogy meaning immoral and despicable people.
sentences.chinese: 你这个衣冠禽兽就知道欺负女人。

sentences.english: Before class begins, one must come prepared, with neat attires and proper posture.
sentences.chinese: 上课之前准备妥当，衣冠端正，姿势亦端。
他是个冷酷无情的衣冠禽兽。

sentences.english: He had not become a trim self-satisfied city man .
sentences.chinese: 他没有变成一个衣冠楚楚，神气十足的城里人。

sentences.english: They chose him for the job because he always looks so well groomed.
sentences.chinese: 他们选他担任该职务，因为他总是衣冠整齐。

sentences.english: The well-dressed men of beastly temper are ubiquitous in every where.
sentences.chinese: 注重外表的衣冠禽兽，普天之下到处都是。

sentences.english: A well-dressed elderly servant opened the door .
sentences.chinese: 一个衣冠楚楚的老仆人开了门。

sentences.english: You are a beast in human attire, you always bully women.
sentences.chinese: 衣冠禽兽就知道欺负女人。

sentences.english: He was always well-dressed and smart-looking.
sentences.chinese: 他总是衣冠楚楚，样子挺帅。

sentences.english: Maybe your casual style doesn't fly in your buttoned-down workplace.
sentences.chinese: 也许那时你随意的风格和衣冠楚楚的工作地点不匹配。

sentences.english: Disarray ChenYan son came to the front of YangJian.
sentences.chinese: 衣冠不整的陈燕儿来到杨坚面前。

sentences.english: Her husband was a real beast.
Performers must be in neat and suitable attires.
The adults are like this, take people to the headgear.
sentences.chinese: 大人们都是这个样子，以衣冠取人。

sentences.english: I never saw him dress out of place.
sentences.chinese: 我从未看过到他衣冠不整。

definition: non-Han tribes in the east and north of ancient China/barbarians
plain cotton clothing/(literary) the common people
(Confucianism) rites and music (the means of regulating society)
the current imperial dynasty/one's own court
